intro: Muehlenbeckia tamnifolia var. oligobotrys, commonly known as the silver-haired woodspur, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its silver-white pubescent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in New Zealand's flora.
